outputs.output_descr:
Environment, Natural Resources mainstreamed in policies, development plans and programmes at national level and implemented in 15 disaster-prone districts

The Environment and Natural Resources Management Programme Support Document to Malawi highlights current and emerging ENRM issues reflected in MGDS II, UNDAF 2012-16 and UNDP CPD 2012-2016 and outlines a strategy to deal with them and prioritized activities under four broad themes: Mainstreaming, Information and Knowledge Management, Coordination and Capacity Development at national and district levels. In general, mainstreaming will be enhanced by support for the expeditious review, harmonisation and enactment of appropriate ENRM legislation and policies and the development of institutional mechanisms at national and district levels. Support for the development of strategic environmental and district land-use plans will lead to an integration of conservation and development plans. Devolution to districts and support for District Assemblies will assist in the implementation of these plans. To bolster Information and knowledge management, direct investments will be made to improve data collection and management, research, periodic environmental data collection and the development of specific indicators and survey techniques. Best management guidelines will be developed and information centres supported to assist in the dissemination of data and information. Better donor and government coordination, through the support of an ENRM sector working group and support to the setting up of a Climate Change, Environment and Natural Resources Management Sector Wide Approach (SWAp) will lead to more effective and efficient decision-making. Human capacity will be enhance by the provision of training at tertiary institutions

Data and Knowledge on the impacts of climate change, environment and natural resources degradation collected and made accessible to decision makers in government, private sector and civil society

Coordination mechanisms and implementation arrangements for Environment & Natural Resources  established and used at national level and in disaster-prone districts.
